title: SVI hosts two-day Islamabad Non-Proliferation Conference 2024
content:
ISLAMABAD, Oct 08 (APP): The Strategic Vision Institute (SVI), Islamabad, hosted Islamabad Non-Proliferation Conference 2024, a two-day international event bringing together a distinguished group of scholars and experts from around the world.
The conference aimed at fostering constructive dialogue on global strategic issues and share Pakistan’s policy perspectives, an Inter Services Public Relations (ISPR) news release said.
Chairman Joint Chiefs of Staff Committee, General Sahir Shamshad Mirza was the Chief Guest. The conference featured keynote addresses delivered by distinguished policymakers and practitioners from Pakistan including Former Chairman Joint Chiefs of Staff Committee, General (R) Zubair Mehmood Hayat, Advisor National Command Authority (NCA), Lt. Gen. Khalid Ahmed Kidwai and Advisor, NCA, Lt. Gen. Sarfraz Sattar.
The participants included prominent international scholars from Institute of World Economy and International Relations of the Russian Academy of Sciences (IMEMO RAS), Center for Energy and Security Studies (CENESS), Russia, China Institute of Contemporary International Relations (CICIR),China, Carnegie Endowment for International Peace, US, Royal United Services Institute(RUSI),UK, Moscow State Institute of International Relations (MGIMO-University), Saint Petersburg State University, Shanghai University, Peking University, University at Albany, State University of New York and University of Birmingham.
This high-level conference not only reinforced Pakistan’s commitment to global non-proliferation efforts but also emphasized the importance of strategic dialogue in maintaining regional and international security.
